definitions.definition: Thinking about unpleasant things that have happened or that might happen; feeling afraid and unhappy.
definitions.example: She was worried about her son who had been sent off to fight in the war.

definitions.definition: To be troubled; to give way to mental anxiety or doubt.
definitions.example: Stop worrying about your test, it’ll be fine.

definitions.definition: Disturb the peace of mind of; afflict with mental agitation or distress.
definitions.example: Your tone of voice worries me.

definitions.definition: To harass; to irritate or distress.
definitions.example: The President was worried into military action by persistent advisors.

definitions.definition: To seize or shake by the throat, especially of a dog or wolf.
definitions.example: Your dog’s been worrying sheep again.

definitions.definition: To touch repeatedly, to fiddle with.
